item.dc:creator: @T41 t4
item.description:
@T41 wrote:

[quote=“Omer_, post:27, topic:445313”][quote author=t4 link=topic=548014.msg4018763#msg4018763 date=1339860039]
ITT: people trying to talk about something they know nothing about (with the exception of Tree and potentially casey)
[/quote]

Then why don’t you contribute? People don’t need to be veterans to know about this.[/quote]
veteran by rank or by longevity? if you mean longevity, then it is sort of required.

auto-rune, srl and the like were all created over at kaitnieks. most older members here, including wL, were members at kaitnieks. proof of concepts were also available there for the elite. where wL is currently unknown the majority, if not all.

[quote=“Alec_, post:28, topic:445313”][quote author=t4 link=topic=548014.msg4018763#msg4018763 date=1339860039]
ITT: people trying to talk about something they know nothing about (with the exception of Tree and potentially casey)
[/quote]

People can know about things without having been there…

History (noun) “inquiry, knowledge acquired by investigation”.[/quote]
Yes, it is entirely possible - but most of the people in this thread most likely don’t have connections to those who were there.

[quote=“Alec_, post:28, topic:445313”][quote author=Omer_ link=topic=548014.msg4018889#msg4018889 date=1339868941]
Then why don’t you contribute? People don’t need to be veterans to know about this.
[/quote]

Because he’s not a veteran, so by his logic he cannot know anything on the subject.[/quote]
sorry to burst your bubble, but my existence in the ‘scene’ is longer than my join date on these forums. an example would be:

Join Date
12-16-2006

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @Tree Tree
item.description:
@Tree wrote:

[quote=“Omer_, post:25, topic:445313”][quote author=Tree link=topic=548014.msg4018437#msg4018437 date=1339818721]

Katnieks spawned this site.

Welcome back, Rash.

@Alec: I’m sure some of them knew him.

They know of him, wL didn’t really hang around mitb much. I guess if you track down semaphore you can ask him…

Who was semaphore and what notable things did he do?
Thanks

I don’t know much about him, but he’s considered one of the best programmers in the community (despite the fact that he has not released anything at all, and that what he’s claimed to have released was ‘private’). If I’m correct this is his twitter: http://twitter.com/#!/notcom. Was found on mitb a few years ago.

He knew more than anyone. I used to chat with him frequently a few years back and he proved his intellect time and time again. Psb was also great but knew just a little less than semaphore. Both taught me a lot. As for wL, he simply moved on like a lot of members have. It’s a little sad returning here every so often and seeing the old crowd slowly wither away. Even the IRC is full of new faces. Maybe it’s a sign for me to finally leave this scene, who knows.
[/quote]

In what aspect was he knowledgeable? Did he know a lot about the RuneScape client and RuneScape hacking or was he an overall excellent programmer?[/quote]

He had knowledge on almost everything. The little bits of private project he allowed me to see were brilliant. He’s been programming for years, so it’s understandable he’s a bit above most here. It’s his job, how he puts food on the table. From what i can remember anyway. I lost contact with him a while ago. Used to communicate over aim, which i hated with a passion.

@vManlyMan: Most of the ‘veterans’ here are relatively new to the scene. Most wouldn’t be of any help.

Read full topic

Katnieks spawned this site.

Welcome back, Rash.

@Alec: I’m sure some of them knew him.

They know of him, wL didn’t really hang around mitb much. I guess if you track down semaphore you can ask him…

Who was semaphore and what notable things did he do?
Thanks
[/quote]

I don’t know much about him, but he’s considered one of the best programmers in the community (despite the fact that he has not released anything at all, and that what he’s claimed to have released was ‘private’). If I’m correct this is his twitter: http://twitter.com/#!/notcom. Was found on mitb a few years ago.[/quote]

He knew more than anyone. I used to chat with him frequently a few years back and he proved his intellect time and time again. Psb was also great but knew just a little less than semaphore. Both taught me a lot. As for wL, he simply moved on like a lot of members have. It’s a little sad returning here every so often and seeing the old crowd slowly wither away. Even the IRC is full of new faces. Maybe it’s a sign for me to finally leave this scene, who knows. I’ve seemed to have lost count of how long I’ve stuck around.

Time really does fly.

Read full topic
